newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Listing for S.Africa's Old Mutual not on agenda.
newsitem.headline: Listing for S.Africa's Old Mutual not on agenda.

text.p: South Africa's largest life insurer Old Mutual is not considering demutualising with a stock exchange listing, an industry source said on Thursday.
"It doesn't seem to be on the agenda," the source, who asked not to be identified, told Reuters.
On Wednesday mutual life insurer Sanlam, second only to Old Mutual in the sector, said it plans to scale back its industrial portfolio and may seek a listing in three to four years.
But analysts speculated that Old Mutual would not seek to follow suit as its capital position is seen as much stronger than Sanlam's.
An Old Mutual spokesman declined to comment on Sanlam's plans or the possibility of it seeking a listing. "We have no comment to make," he said.
